item.source: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?

item.title: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:64, topic:193286”]I apologize Legit. Opera is pretty awesome. And I over stepped my bounds. I tried out the beta, looked at some of the features that come default. It’s actually handy, the Speed dial thing. I’m still a Firefox user, but I did like some of the Features in Opera.

All I really have to say is, now that the release of Beta 5 of Firefox 3 is out, and it has improved by 3%, that just means that they will continue to improve Firefox, and once it has reached 100%, how will the two browsers compete then? Acid4? I’m thinking Mobile browsing. With a plan for a Mobile Firefox, that seems to be the only place to go for Mozilla, that and development of it’s amazing browser/other programs.[/quote]

Thanks for being open minded about it, ThatOneGuy. That’s some serious respect there.

And yea, if Firefox offers better features than Opera, then I’ll definitely switch over. But I mean, so far, Opera is winning the battle, but Firefox 3 is gonna be a serious contender.

Read full topic
item.source: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?

item.title: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I apologize Legit. Opera is pretty awesome. And I over stepped my bounds. I tried out the beta, looked at some of the features that come default. It’s actually handy, the Speed dial thing. I’m still a Firefox user, but I did like some of the Features in Opera.

All I really have to say is, now that the release of Beta 5 of Firefox 3 is out, and it has improved by 3%, that just means that they will continue to improve Firefox, and once it has reached 100%, how will the two browsers compete then? Acid4? I’m thinking Mobile browsing. With a plan for a Mobile Firefox, that seems to be the only place to go for Mozilla, that and development of it’s amazing browser/other programs.

Read full topic
item.source: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?

item.title: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:49, topic:193286”]Cool, me too. Although i don’t see how that is relevant.

xxlegitxx, Please stop trying to force your opinions on to other people, if people wanted to use opera they would use it. People obviously prefer firefox for some reason, whatever reason that is it should not effect you. I see you always attacking firefox and the people that use it, almost as if you are mad at them for using it. Sure i’ll post things like ‘Opera sux’ but thats usually to see yours and a few other peoples reaction.[/quote]

Point out where I am forcing opinions on others.

And point out where I am attacking people who use Firefox.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:49, topic:193286”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=257271.msg2155693#msg2155693 date=1207180747]

I love how xxlegitxx defends Opera with his life.

I love how wannabe gangsters tend to exaggerate.
[/quote]
Cool, me too. Although i don’t see how that is relevant.

xxlegitxx, Please stop trying to force your opinions on to other people, if people wanted to use opera they would use it. People obviously prefer firefox for some reason, whatever reason that is it should not effect you. I see you always attacking firefox and the people that use it, almost as if you are mad at them for using it. Sure i’ll post things like ‘Opera sux’ but thats usually to see yours and a few other peoples reaction.[/quote]
XxLegitxX does not force anyone to change to Opera, but inform about a better, faster and more secure browser.

@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I have to be honest. Before I switched to FireFox 3 Beta 4 last night on this computer. The current stable release of Firefox I was using was constantly crashing. It crashed about 3 times. Once while uploading the images to Imageshack, and the other two visiting this website. I only got a 54% when I used the current stable release of FF.

Read full topic

item.source: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?

item.title: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:37, topic:193286”]There is no way in Hell that I fucked up Opera. It was a fresh install, never used. I had just used it then. My skin has nothing to do with it. Want me to try it on a Windows Xp Professional PC without anything on it? Will that satisfy you?

Why do you bother comparing the current stable release of Firefox with the Beta of Opera? Why not keep them in their respectful categories. My Firefox opens immediately when I click the shortcut icon on my start bar. Do I care how long it takes? No, I care about functionality. And with all of the Add-ons, and the VERY simple layout of Firefox, it allows me to do what needs to be done.[/quote]

It should be your quest for knowledge that drives you to decide which browser is better, not to satisfy others.

I compared the beta release of Firefox with the beta of Opera while you compared the beta of Firefox with the stable release of Opera. So I ask you to “keep them in their respectful categories.”

And Opera has most USEFUL addons built in already, while you can download various widgets to satisfy whatever excessiveness you would like. And you can disable extraneous toolbars in Firefox.

ThugLife:

I love how xxlegitxx defends Opera with his life.

I love how wannabe gangsters tend to exaggerate.

cooper:

Doesn’t it cost money, though? I remember being hassled for $5 every time I tried to search something…

No, it doesn’t.

Cowie`:

I <3 Opera and I has always used it, but I wouldn’t go to these lengths to fkin defend it

What lengths? Typing a few words?

Moparisthebest:

Actually that is flawed logic. Because opera is closed-source it is more prone to security holes and they get fixed much slower, which is simply one of the many reasons why firefox is better.

Yea, uh… funny story about that.

http://secunia.com/product/10615/?task=advisories
“There are no unpatched Secunia advisories affecting this product [Opera], when all vendor patches are applied.”

http://secunia.com/product/12434/?task=advisories
“The most severe unpatched Secunia advisory affecting Mozilla Firefox 2.0.x, with all vendor patches applied, is rated Less critical.”

Read full topic
item.source: First browser to pass the Acid3 test?
